PermissionInformation.PublisherPermissionText: The most representative primary tracheobronchial tumors are described with their more frequent location. Reprinted from Seminars in Pediatric Surgery, Volume 25, Issue 3, Patricio Varela, Luca Pio, Michele Torre, Primary tracheobronchial tumors in children, Pages 150-155, Copyright (2016), with permission from Elsevier.
PermissionInformation.Comment: Per SQK, image will not be translated into Spanish, but okay to translate labels, caption, and content description
Image approved by Pediatric Treatment Editorial Board; copyright permissions received

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Drawing showing the most representative primary tracheobronchial tumors in children: myofibroblastic inflammatory tumor, carcinoid, rhabdomyoma, granular cell tumor, and mucoepidermoid K.

Captions.MediaCaption: The most representative primary tracheobronchial tumors are described with their more frequent location.
